title: [REST] Request to add /rest/ignores2 API

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

body:
I'm implementing ignore functionality for the [Syncthing-inotify](https://github.com/Zillode/syncthing-inotify) application. It was nice too see there was a way to extract the ignore information from the Syncthing app.

Currently the /rest/ignores API looks as follows:

```
GET /rest/ignores

Takes one parameter, folder, and returns either the content of the .stignore , or an error.

$ curl -s http://localhost:8080/rest/ignores?folder=default | json_pp
{
   "ignore" : [
      "Thumbs.db",
      "#include anotherfile",
      "",
      "// Comment",
      "somefile"
   ]
}
```

Unfortunately this does not provide a lot of functionality for clients (besides GUIs): it just reads the .stignore file. Other ignored files such as `.stversions`, `.stfolder` and `.syncthing.*` are missing. Keeping an up to date list with upstream is error prone (i.e. when `.stfolder` was added all clients would need to be informed to update their code).
Additionally, the ``#include` functionality requires clients to read out files. This is also redundant functionality that Syncthing already implements.

I propose to add an extra `/rest/ignores2` API in one of the following ways:
1) return a complete list of items to be ignored (including .st\* files and #include arguments, without comments)
2) Same as 1) but with _all_ ignore patterns translated to regular expressions. Could this include negated ignores? Maybe a remark can be added such that the client should only be executed on the same OS as Syncthing is running (to reduce confusion of slash and blackslash).
